fdisk allows you to manage your partition table, parted,mkfs allows you to format
is there already a partition set up?
what do you want to format it as?
mkfs.vfat /dev/sdb1
where sdb1 is the partition you want to format
my pendrive is in /media as disk.. so i tried mkfs.vfat /media/disk it didnt work ..
no, /media/disk is the mount point of that partition
if you type "mount", it will show you what device is mounted at that mountpoint
you want to mkfs on that. it should be in /dev
